name: VOGUENET
description:
VOGUENET is an experimental Twine adventure game about coping with excessive hedonism through usage of a scantly-constructed user terminal. It's rude, rudimentary, and above all rough around the edges, but its vision is clear. The aim in making VOGUENET is to simulate a brief, tense, yet enjoyable user experience while lampooning genre conventions surrounding text adventures, the internet, and the overall obsessions of people. Intended primarily as a proof of concept, VOGUENET aims to be a powerful step forward into much greater ideas -- a post-apocalypse of the mind that brings hope to a new beginning... Something that is aimed to be shown through its content as well as its own design process! 

Essentially, I view VOGUENET as a small part of a much greater whole, but my goal is that it can also be played as an entirely stand-alone experience -- giving the player a slice of life in an abstract other world...

"VOGUENET W SOUND" download features ambient noise and is considered (by its creator) to be the preferred way to experience the game.

USER AVATARS are made in collaboration between me (Slantac) and HallowVortex.

All other assets by Petra Tsimberov/slantac.
